docs.lead_paragraph: In our great democracy, we rarely have the option to put someone in office who isn’t part of the elite.

headline.main: Which Millionaire Are You Voting For?
headline.print_headline: Which Millionaire Are You Voting For?

docs.abstract: Op-Ed article by public policy Prof Nicholas Carnes observes that voters in America are rarely given option of voting for someone who is not rich; contends it is time for citizens who care about political equality to begin to invest in working-class candidates for higher office, in much same way that gender inequality in government has been addressed.
docs.snippet: In our great democracy, we rarely have the option to put someone in office who isn’t part of the elite.

docs.lead_paragraph: Long before my iPhone 4 introduced me to Siri, it brought Sharlene into my life.
docs.abstract: Loose Ends column by Adrian Harris Forman describes dilemma of having someone's old phone number as your own, and having to field calls from people who have not updated their contact information.
docs.snippet: Long before my iPhone 4 introduced me to Siri, it brought Sharlene into my life.

docs.lead_paragraph: A small cafe, in the small city of Elyria, Ohio, is being tested by a tough economy. It is the kind of place where Barack Obama and Mitt Romney each hope that his promise of a restored American dream will resonate.

headline.seo: This Land: Losing Sleep but Not Hope at a Diner in Elyria, Ohio
headline.main: At the Corner of Hope and Worry
headline.print_headline: At the Corner of Hope and Worry

docs.abstract: Dan Barry This Land column examines ways in which Donna's Diner in Elyria, Ohio, has been tested by tough economy in wake of recession; small city in which diner, whose proprietor is Donna Dove, is located is exactly the kind of place, and is facing exactly the kind of challenges and disappointments, where Pres Obama and Mitt Romney hope their promises of restored American dream will resonate (Series: Donna's Diner).
docs.snippet: A small cafe, in the small city of Elyria, Ohio, is being tested by a tough economy. It is the kind of place where Barack Obama and Mitt Romney each hope that his promise of a restored American dream will resonate.

docs.lead_paragraph: Particularly in the last two years of his term, Mitt Romney was often missing from Massachusetts on personal trips or political ones unrelated to his job.

headline.seo: Mitt Romney Often Away When He Was Governor
headline.main: As Massachusetts Governor, Romney Was Often Away
headline.print_headline: As Massachusetts Governor, Romney Was Often Away

docs.abstract: Mitt Romney, particularly in the last two years of his term as governor of Massachusetts, was often out of state on personal trips or to lay groundwork for his presidential ambitions in the 2008 election, two years after he left office; no one points to any lapses from his absences, but some former constituents, particularly Democrats, say his travels suggest he was more interested in attaining the governor's post than in doing the job.
docs.snippet: Particularly in the last two years of his term, Mitt Romney was often missing from Massachusetts on personal trips or political ones unrelated to his job.

docs.lead_paragraph: Christopher Kimball refuses to celebrate anything smacking of joie de vivre. Therein lies his success.

headline.seo: Cook’s Illustrated’s Christopher Kimball Believes Cooking Is Ultraserious Business
headline.main: ‘Cooking Isn’t Creative, and It Isn’t Easy’
headline.print_headline: ’Cooking isn’t creative and it isn’t easy’

docs.abstract: Alex Halberstadt article explores the success of Cook's Illustrated; cooking manual was created by Christopher Kimball, who has edited and published it for 19 years.
docs.snippet: Christopher Kimball refuses to celebrate anything smacking of joie de vivre. Therein lies his success.

docs.lead_paragraph: From the beginning of his presidential campaign, Mitt Romney has offered to transfigure himself any which way to achieve power. Nothing’s changed.
docs.abstract: Editorial criticizes Mitt Romney for adopting a superficial moderate tone in order to appease voters in general campaign; accuses him of disguising the deep conservatism he espoused in the primaries and that continues to make up the core of his platform.
docs.snippet: From the beginning of his presidential campaign, Mitt Romney has offered to transfigure himself any which way to achieve power. Nothing’s changed.

docs.lead_paragraph: Readers analyze the style and content of the debate.
docs.snippet: Readers analyze the style and content of the debate.

headline.main: Talk at Ad Conference Turns to Risk, Failure and Mistakes

docs.abstract: Advertising ought to be more of a risky business, according to some of the speakers at the 2012 annual conference of the Association of National Advertisers.
docs.snippet: Advertising ought to be more of a risky business, according to some of the speakers at the 2012 annual conference of the Association of National Advertisers.

docs.abstract: Readers comment on my column about my old college roommate, now battling cancer in part because of our flawed health care system.
docs.snippet: Readers comment on my column about my old college roommate, now battling cancer in part because of our flawed health care system.

headline.main: Assessing the Value of Medicaid to Its Enrollees

docs.abstract: A change in the approach to valuing benefits as part of a family’s or individual’s income may have significant effects in defining who is impoverished.
docs.snippet: A change in the approach to valuing benefits as part of a family’s or individual’s income may have significant effects in defining who is impoverished.
